meanings.sent1: The unweathered rock looked exactly the same as it did when it was first found.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the unweathered metal to understand its properties better.
meanings.sent3: The unweathered statue seemed to mock the elements, standing strong and untouched.
meanings.sent4: Her unweathered determination to succeed was like a shield against any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The unweathered paint on the old house made it stand out among the weathered buildings.

meanings.definition: Not worn or eroded by weather.
meanings.sent1: The unweathered path through the forest was smooth and untouched.
meanings.sent2: The unweathered fence still looked brand new despite being outside for years.
meanings.sent3: The unweathered shoes seemed to dance happily in the rain, unaffected by the wet ground.
meanings.sent4: His unweathered smile brightened up even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The unweathered roof of the barn gleamed under the sun, a stark contrast to the rusty tools inside.

meanings.definition: Not changed or altered by weather.
meanings.sent1: The unweathered document retained its original ink color, unaffected by time.
meanings.sent2: The unweathered fabric felt soft and new, despite being stored in the attic for years.
meanings.sent3: The unweathered clock seemed to defy the passing of time, ticking steadily without a pause.
meanings.sent4: Her unweathered memories of childhood were like precious treasures, untouched by the years.
meanings.sent5: The unweathered flag fluttered proudly in the breeze, a symbol of unwavering strength and resilience.
